main event: On June 26, 1949, observers reported seeing a brilliant blue-green fireball that lasted approximately 3 to 3.5 seconds while moving southerly across the sky.
interesting points: The fireball was estimated to be between half and two-thirds the size of the moon,The object was seen about 5 degrees below the star Altair in the constellation of the Big Dipper,Unlike typical fireballs, this one did not produce a hissing sound or leave a lighted trail,Reports mention multiple witnesses, including members of scientific institutions such as the American Meteor Society,It was reported to have no accompanying sounds, unlike what is expected with usual fireballs.
witness description: Observers included civilians and members of scientific institutions.
